column4: it does not really matter because both are working fine but any idea why winxp and xubuntu would show different ip's?
that would be my ip
I don't understand. Are you running a dual boot?
for now am running xubuntu as wubi
Forgive me, but when you install with wubi, does it install a dual boot or is it virtualization?
it is a real install on a virtual disk as far as I know (not positive though)
I guess without getting too into it, there's a half dozen reasons why the two would have different ips, it's nothing to worry about
not worried just curious...my ip comes from my cable company and rarely changes in windows just curious as to why it is not the same in xubuntu...like I said it is not important just curious
Are you getting two different external ip addresses or are you behind a router?
it is an external ip - I have no router...just a nic to a cable modem and then to the cable company
If the two installs use the same nic, I have no idea why you could get a different dhcp lease.
Do you have one NIC or multiple?
just one
Yeah, it's strange. Either the DHCP server is messing with you, or maybe on your old windows install you manually set an ip address and your ubuntu is on automatic.

Typically, the dhcp server picks up o your hardware and gives you an IP. With cable, this will typically not change, and if it changes, it will be once and it will be permanent (because the company moved ip blocks or restarted their dhcp server or something)
yes i agree it is strange...only think in windows is ip assigned by dhcp
as far as I know the cable company assigns ip's by the mac address so that makes it even more strange...like I said was just curious
Right. Based upon your description, I don't know why it would behave that way.
if I just use the livecd my ip changes every time I boot so to me at least makes no sense
How are you viewing your ip address?
ifconfig
*shrug* dunno. Dynamic addresses are dynamic.
well thanks for the time - eventually maybe I can figure out why (not that it matters).
np
